meanings.definition: To make a wet, splashing sound.
meanings.sent1: The rain glopped against the window.
meanings.sent2: The children glopped in the puddles after the storm.
meanings.sent3: The chef glopped the pancake batter onto the sizzling griddle.
meanings.sent4: The basketball glopped through the net, scoring the winning point.
meanings.sent5: The horse's hooves glopped through the muddy trail.

meanings.sent1: She spread the glopped glue on the paper.
meanings.sent2: The honey was so glopped that it wouldn't pour out of the jar.
meanings.sent3: The monster's drool was a glopped mess on the floor.
meanings.sent4: The mud on his shoes felt like a heavy glopped weight.
meanings.sent5: The paint had dried into a glopped blob on the palette.
